column5: I wouldn't do it that is a real hotspot for pollutants. I have a hard time eating them even from Erie if I think about it. I've had fish from certain sections of the Thames and lived to tell about it, although wouldn't do that again once I found out how many treatment plants dump back in.  With regards to Lake O...just remember.... crap runs downhill AND downstream

Look up Pangasius on Google. Its becomeing the most popular freshwater fish in the world.What you see will scare the heck out of you.Compared to how they are farmed, i dont think fish from our lakes are all that bad to eat in MODERATION.
One meal isnt going to hurt anyone.
One meal of poo probably won't hurt you too much, but doesn't mean I'm grabbing my spoon and digging in.  That harbor is disgusting. Don't eat it.

Personally I wouldn't eat that bass....too old in a very bad environment as per what I have read here. But other fish from Ontario I have and still will eat....Red meat will get you way before a few salmon from Lake Ontario will.  BTW I wouldn't eat ANY bass from anywhere...but that's just me...crappie, perch and walleye are in my freezer...learn to catch them and you wouldn't eat a bass either.  Bob

get the free book called "guide to eating sportfish" its free,all over the place and check it might be online too...its got testing results from all over ontarios different lakes and rivers...specially the great lakes and you would be suprised how clean some size fish are from lake o....up to about 7lbs rainbows and stuff like that get some really good results,and yet some lakes even way up north have do not any fish posted for them...its very informative,and interesting,i think the last issue for the book was 2010 they used to have them at the beer store and liquor stores,mto offices,and some fishing stores had them...check it out
+1  It also evaporates and rains down on the rest of the world.
I eat salmon out of the Credit once in a blue moon, and I cut the belly meat off too, I find the meat to be a little more firm then if caught up in Wasaga, but fish is fish (for the most part).

Pretty disturbing, but not less so then everything else, lol. I actually bought a few fillets last fall, and I prepared it much like most would do a walleye. One bite later and the fish was in the garbage. The texture was akin to eating fried fat, but more tender. Totally inedible
With the amount of mercury in it, you could probably hang it up and use it as a thermometer.
I have a personal rule I follow with regard to eating fish... If the fish has either the Farenheit or Celcius scale stamped on it's side, it goes back in the drink. HH

I read a study sometime back about smallies and methylmercury content, and it found that smallies in the 15" range had less than .7ppm, which is lower than the 1ppm for the market standard.  Smallie in the 17" range averaged 1.1ppm I believe.  Of course I cant remember where I read it, or what bodie(s) of water it involved.  PCB's are a concern as well, but this is where cutting out the fat content helps. Methylmercury on the other hand is throughout the entire fish
What kind of "drink" goes good with a fish...  :rofl2:
A fishky sour.
Icaught a big bass from the hamilton harbour wondering if I could eat it? around 4 lbs.

I certainly wouldn't eat it.  No way if you are a child or pregnant mom.  That's an older fish.  More time for pollutants to accumulate.  The MNR publishes a "Guide to Eating Fish in Ontario"  Have a look for yourself
I would probably feed it to the raccoons.
Thanks guys for the input, I was thinking of giving it to the raccoons if it wasent edible!
Another factor is that gobies are just not bottom feeders. Gobies eat zebra muscles. Zebra muscles are chock full of toxins.  Don't put that fish to waste though...use it as fertilizer.
Please explain being a 'responsible angler' to your buddy!
For the harbour, large mouth bass from 10-20'', 4 meal per month. See page 244. http://www.ene.gov.on.ca/stdprodconsume/groups/lr/@ene/@resources/documents/resource/std01_079301.pdf
It'll be fine
Invite your buddy over for dinner and choke it down over a nice bottle of red wine.
like others said, use it as fertilizer, I wouldn't eat a fish that big out of that water either.
Most of the toxins accumulate in the belly fat.Cut that part out, and it should be ok once in a while.
I wouldn't eat it.
Can be any worse then some of the conditions that the other meat we eat lives in. Ever see some of those factory farmed chicken coops?
It's better than any of the processed fish you're buying in Food Basics.....

most of the fish i catch in the harbourfront area are covered in lesions and boils of unknown origin. the anchor comes up out of the bay covered in inches of thick oily slag. when i was a kid at sailing school on the bay we'd overturn our boats in rough weather. if you accidentally swallowed some water you would puke almost right away. bodies way of telling ya something. i've been advised by local marinas to flush the motor every time you go in the bay due to the water being so caustic.  who cares what the book says. if ya want fish tonite try the fish market.  i wouldn't eat a 4lb bass from any lake that's a personal thing....
I happen to know a raccoon you could feed it to!!!!

Eat the fish, and try not to over think things.  Everything on this earth is contaminated, and the earlier post about chicken etc is bang on.  Fish every once in awhile is not gonna kill you, certainly not before anything else your exposed to will.
Have him over for dinner, serve him the head over lettuce, and be sure to take a pic when he takes that first bite!!
MMmmmmmmmmmmm  You showered this morning, made a couple coffees, brushed your teeth, cooked dinner and went swimming at your local pool.  You people are funny.

ahah well i don't see it being too bad, atleast not as bad as some of the stuff i've seen while working.. people poaching half dead salmon and keeping carp/suckers and selling them at their restaurants in Toronto labeling them only as "Fish", duped wayyy too many people and the fines don't seem to be enough of a deterrant.

While we are on the topic of eating bass...for all you bass eaters..do you'll have a personal size limit for largies and smallies beyond which you wouldnt eat em.. I dont usually eat largies since i am not a fan of the taste of the fish but dont mind filleting a smallie every now and then...Usually keep fish in the 15 -17 inch slot....but the more I think about it..fish that big here in Canada are pretty old...thoughts?
Did it look like this? If so, I'd eat it, maybe you'll become an X-Men?

I would not eat any fish coming from lake Ontario . I have seen fishermen dragging half rotten salmon around, but I assumed they needed the eggs from the fish and were taking the fish home for fertilizer instead of throwing it in the bush to smell. I can not imagine anyone desperate enough to eat those half rotted salmon.

Serve it with Flava beans and some Chianti.  Jokes aside, you should eat it and document what happens.  No seriously, I read an article a few years back stating Hamilton Harbour was in the top 20 most toxic freshwater sites in North America, which eventaully led to the environmental cleanup project ongoing.
